translated: Points of Controversy
The Minor Collection
The Twentieth Section
Discussion of not being without

analyzed: puthujjanaḥ tedhātukehi dhammehi a vivittaḥ ti
translated: Is an ordinary person not without the things of the three realms?
“Yes.”
“Is an ordinary person not without the contacts of the three realms …

analyzed: tedhātukā hi vedanā  saññāhi  cetanā hi  cittehi
translated: the feelings of the three realms …🔽the perceptions of the three realms …🔽the volitions of the three realms …🔽the consciousness of the three realms …
the beliefs of the three realms …
the energies of the three realms …
the mindfulnesses of the three realms …
the concentrations of the three realms …
the wisdoms of the three realms?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: puthujjanaḥ tedhātukehi kammehi a vivittaḥ ti
translated: “Is an ordinary person not without the actions of the three realms?”
“Yes.”

original: Yasmiṁ khaṇe puthujjano cīvaraṁ deti, tasmiṁ khaṇe paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati …pe…
analyzed: yasmin khaṇe puthujjanaḥ cīvaram deti tasmin khaṇe paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati pe
translated: “In the moment an ordinary person gives a robe, does he enter and emerge from the first jhāna …
the base of the infinity of space?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: yasmiṁ khaṇe puthujjano piṇḍapātaṁ deti …pe…🔽senāsanaṁ deti …pe…
analyzed: yasmin khaṇe puthujjanaḥ piṇḍapātam deti pe  senāsanam deti pe
translated: “In the moment an ordinary person gives alms food …🔽a dwelling …

original: gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ deti, tasmiṁ khaṇe catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati …
analyzed: gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāram deti tasmin khaṇe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: a medicinal requisites, does he enter and emerge from the fourth jhāna …

analyzed: nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: and the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception?”🔽“That can’t be said.”
“It follows then that you shouldn’t say

analyzed: puthujjanaḥ tedhātukehi kammehi a vivittaḥ ti
translated: that a worldling is not free from the three kinds of action.”

analyzed: āmantā  puthujjanassa rūpa dhātu a rūpa dhātu upagam kammam pariññātanti
translated: “I deny that.”🔽“Then it must be admitted that a worldling is free from the action that leads to the form and formless worlds.”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Tena hi puthujjano tedhātukehi kammehi avivittoti …pe….
analyzed: tena hi puthujjanaḥ tedhātukehi kammehi a vivittaḥ ti pe
translated: “Then you must admit that a worldling is not free from the three kinds of action.”
The discussion of “not free” is finished.
